Steam Greenligh – done!
«Stop The Earth, I'm Getting Off»
Genre: kinetic visual novel, science fiction, fantasy, mysticism, adventure, humor, ecchi.
Brief description: Brief description: You are young and smart but your thick-lensed glasses make you persona non-grata at the feast of life. Nonetheless, an unexpected chance turns up for you to become a man. The only thing is, during sex you find out that having it teleports you to other worlds. Which you’ll have to save from global disasters and catastrophes. But for a start you should try to return home. How? The same way you got there, find a girl and try not to fall in love with her. Because if you do this thing right you will probably never see her again...
Text copy of video
Roman
Roman: – Greetings visual novel lovers! Because this video is intended for visual novel lovers I decided to get in the game. Now I can tell you about our project from inside the game. To begin with, my name is Roman. I'm also from Russia. But don't think you'll see any vodka, balalaikas or Gorbatchov in the game. What is more, we don't have bears walking our streets and there are no... What? The painting on the wall? Fine, I'll admit it, they do walk the streets. And we ride them. At least this famous gentleman does. But no balalaikas for sure! Or matryoshkas... But there will be cute girls. Like the one on TV for example.
Natalie
Roman: – That is Natalie and she is one of the game characters. If we raise enough money to create the full version you will have a chance to meet her. Perhaps even a bit more than meet. =^__^= In the short demo version you will get to spend time with Linda.
Roman and Linda
Linda: – Hi! I'm the Linda that will send the main character to another world. In quite an interesting way...
Roman: – Stop! No spoilers! Let the readers see it for themselves. There will be a link to the demo-version on the page.
Linda: – I just wanted to say...
Roman: – Shush woman, you talk more than enough in the game. Give the men a word.
Linda: – Pff... Men...
Roman: – Sweetie, we love you the way you are, but talking to you wasn't the reason I got in the game...
Linda: – What? How dare you! You hurt my feelings...
Save menu
Roman: – I'm here to tell about the amazing project we're working on. What a great musician we have! What a fantastic artist! What a wonderful translator! Even the writer-programmer-team lead is not so bad. Only they don't want to work for free for some reason... Strange guys. I understand. Making games puts food on their table. But they could wait six months or so. It's not like they have to eat every day or pay the rent... But then again, they probably won't be making games then. Well then, we'll have to help them out. I already paid them some money myself but I'm afraid that without your help the project won't see the light of day. So let's raise at least a thousand dollars for the first part. Actually, we don't have to stop at that and raise more. The more we raise the more parts of the novel will be created. And the most generous benefactors will get to join me and Linda in the game. Huh, I like it here! I don't even want to go back to the 3D world. Mind if I stay?
Linda: – Sure, you can stay.
Roman: – Great... Wait! Linda, why are you the one to decide?
Linda: – Because the writer isn't in the game. He said he's not photogenic. So I have to talk for him. I'm extremely photogenic!
Roman: – Can't argue with that. But the writer could've joined us too. Who cares what you look like. You can be anyone in the game! Linda: – He says he will think about it.
Roman: – Too late. It's not free anymore. Those who, like I, will help the developers will have the opportunity to become part of the game as characters. Well then, let's start? Let's help an interesting game come into existence!?
Linda: – Bye-bye! P.S.: We have minigames! Just a couple but there will be more.
Mini-game «Escape from the room»
Mini-game «Show me your boobs»
 P.S.: We have minigames! Just a couple but there will be more.

campaign.story:
Kacey's story comes to an end. The Invisible Apartment cyberpunk visual novel series began in 2014 and has seen three parts of the series get to Steam, the iTunes app store and Itch.
Kacey & Alex find themselves in a complicated situation. They're both on the run, Alex no longer works at the Central Intelligence and they don't know the whereabouts of Alex's mom who is detained in a sleeper cell. What will our two heroes do? 
In case you want to know more about the story, get the other parts of the series through Steam (part 1, 2, Zero) or Itch.io (part 1, 2, Zero). Or if you own an iPad you can find the IA series on the iTunes app store here (part 1, 2, Zero).
We will use the money raised for the final stages of the production - the editing of the texts and for putting all the assets together and packaging the visual novel into app format. The money raised will help us pay for Daniel Meyer who did the editing of Invisible Apartment 2 which received good reviews. The artist, Henrique "Kite" Xavier is being payed from the revenue we make by selling the other parts of the series. Music is licensed and the musicians receive a percentage of each unit sold on a quarterly basis.
Illustrations
Kacey on books
A lot of masks
Dive into a virtual world filled with avatars, intrigues, traps and hidden places.
Meet Yuki
In a sleeper cell
The series revolves around sleeper cells, a conspiracy, hackers and the top brass running the futuristic hi-tech city of New Jessica.
Londo's office
New Jessica skyline
Soundtrack
People
Story & production - Milan Kazarka
Development - Jeroen van Oosten
Art - Henrique "Kite" Xavier
Postproduction - Vincent Karovič
Desktop publishing - Peter Karovič
Screenplay assistance - Natália Novotná
Editing - Daniel Meyer
Music - Sebastian Bach
Music - Søren Nissen Jørgensen
Music - Oliver Dombi
This part of the series will again be illustrated by the talented Henrique "Kite" Xavier.
Music will be provided by Sebastian Bach, Søren Nissen Jørgensen & Oliver Dombi. It will again be a combination of neoclassical and dark ambient tracks which makes the audio-visual atmosphere of the series so unique.
Sebastian Bach
A new addition to our team is Natália Novotná who has been working on theatre plays for years and is helping with screenwriting.
The art-book / The Making Of-book is again put together by Peter Karovič from all of the various illustrations. Peter works at a local publishing house and is responsible there for putting together pages of various magazines.
Rewards
We're working on a "Making Of" which will also include an art-book. Choose the second reward to get the story behind Invisible Apartment as well as background info about Vysoko Anime Production itself over the course of the last three years.
Artbook test pages
Invisible Apartment 3 DVDs
Platforms
As with part Zero, 1 and 2 we will support Windows, OSX, Linux and the iPad. The game has already been greenlit so we'll also come to Steam and Itch.io.
Supported platforms
There is also work being done on porting our engine to the Apple TV. We'll then be releasing the whole series for the platform. Here's a video capture of a prototype of Invisible Apartment 2 port running on the Apple TV:
PLAY

Stretch goals
2000 euro - we will work on Invisible Apartment 1 REX. After delivering Invisible Apartment 3 we will give Daniel Meyer the texts of part one of the series, so that they'll be professionally edited for the first time. A major complaint with the initial part of the series were the texts. We will also fill in some blanks and extend some scenes when necessary without compromising the original story. The whole series will feel more consistent. This goal won't endanger the delivery dates of part 3.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We rushed too much with the production and the launch of the campaign for Invisible Apartment 3 last year. We didn't yet have enough materials last November, but we choose to ask for money anyway back then. Afterwards we realised that we need to give our audience something different. Anyway, we continued production from the revenue from the sale of Invisible Apartment 2 and 0. The production is going half-paced, but it seems that that's actually better, since it gives us more time.

We now have most of the illustrations and music, so the project is on the right track.

campaign.story:
Reward update
Developed over two years by our team, SC2VN released in September 2015 to acclaim by eSports veterans and newcomers alike. The story of Mach, a foreign StarCraft 2 player that put it all on the line, was one that many fans told us they resonated with.The demand to learn more about the world of eSports and the struggle that its competitors contend with went beyond our expectations. 
You can play the original game on Steam to experience what caused so many people to push for another installment of the series.  
Play the game that started it all.
 A sequel to SC2VN was never part of the plan. But you, our fans, have made it clear that we have stories left to tell. We agree.
Team Eleven is happy to announce our next visual novel, Don’t Forget Our eSports Dream, a prequel to SC2VN set in the Brood War era of South Korea’s professional StarCraft scene.  
We have received permission from Blizzard Entertainment, Inc. to use their assets in our upcoming game. StarCraft®, StarCraft®: Brood War®, StarCraft® II: Wings of Liberty®, and StarCraft® II: Heart of the Swarm®, StarCraft® II: Legacy of the Void® images and audio provided by Blizzard Entertainment, Inc.
“Why shouldn’t it be you or me? Nobody in that booth was born with the right to sit there.”
Experience the peak of Brood War through the eyes of a young and idealistic up-and-comer, Sung-hwan “Bolt” Lee. Beholden to the idea that only the best players deserve to live and train in South Korea, Bolt contends equally with setbacks and triumphs in the chase for his eSports dreams.
At his side is Chae-young “Jett” Song, a former darling of the Korean Pro-Gaming Association and an estranged childhood friend. A year after her departure from the professional Brood War competition, Jett continues to make her living on StarCraft on low-paying local tournaments and betmatches. Together, she and Bolt strive to become champions and to resolve their differences along the way.
Their journey takes them to rival PC bangs, international tournaments, the offices of Korea’s top eSports officials, and into the booth at the highest level of professional StarCraft.
The game will feature  
Larger gameplay and narrative scope in comparison to its predecessor (we are shooting for 3X)
An authentic story that is both true to eSports fans and relatable to a general audience
Player choices for both character interactions and StarCraft strategies.
Sequences featuring both StarCraft Brood War games and original reimagined StarCraft art. 
A glossary of StarCraft and eSports terms for new players
Galleries for character and background art
Steam Trading Cards and Achievements
We’re returning to Kickstarter more than two years since our original SC2VN crowdfunding campaign back in September 2013. Since then, our team has learned not only about how to develop a visual novel effectively, but also how we best work together. The six members returning members of Team Eleven are:
TJ Huckabee - Writer and Creative Director
Tim Young - Producer and Developer
Glynnis Koike - Art Director, Character Design, & Color
Stephanie Yang - Character Artist
Rosendo Loste - Background Artist 
Collin Babb - Musician
We developed SC2VN with a budget of roughly $7,000 after Kickstarter fees, most of which went to art. With our base funding goal of $35,000, we can vastly increase the quality and polish of Don’t Forget Our eSports Dream in terms of length, art quantity, and player choice. If you, our backers, are interested in supporting us past that base goal, we’re ready to push our project to the next level.
Side Stories - $40,000
Catch up with Enoch Red and explore the backstories of Accel, Stunt, and Reva, characters from SC2VN, in four unlockable bonus scenes.
Voice Acting - $55,000
Casting/Directing by Chris Sabat (best known as the voice of the Vegeta) of Okratron 5000. With everyone’s effort to unlock the goal, we’ll provide updates and samples throughout the casting and recording process.
                                                                The team will be streaming on Twitch at http://www.twitch.tv/esportsdreamvn  
Stop by during our streams to ask questions, interact with the developers, and hang out with other community guests! Keep your eyes peeled to our Twitter and Kickstarter page for updates on stream events.
Following the channel is the best way to get notified when the stream goes live.
 When will this game be released?
We’re shooting for about a year after our Kickstarter finishes, around May 2017. The Kickstarter is set to launch at April 10, 2016 and will conclude in May.
Is this a dating sim?
We have nothing against dating sims, but this isn't one. 
How much will this cost?
We plan to price Don’t Forget Our eSports Dream at $14.99 on Steam. Backers receive the game at a lower price.
Is there a demo?
You can play SC2VN on Steam to get an idea of the base we are building on. We plan to expand all aspects of our game beyond the first. 
Do I need to know about StarCraft or eSports to enjoy this game?
No. Like SC2VN, we're crafting Don't Forget Our eSports Dream in a way that even those who know little to nothing about eSports can still enjoy the game.
How can I help support this project?
Aside from backing our Kickstarter, the most helpful thing you can do is to spread the word and tell your friends about the game.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Don’t Forget Our eSports Dream is Team Eleven’s second visual novel about eSports in South Korean. We will provide regular updates and relay major changes to Don’t Forget Our eSports Dream’s creative vision throughout the development process. In order for us to deliver the best experience possible, we ask that you please respect our team’s creative decisions as we iterate on our current ideas. If you have any questions or feedback for the team, please email us at eSportsDreamVN (at) gmail (dot) com.

Don’t Forget Our eSports Dream can only be developed if this Kickstarter campaign succeeds.

campaign.story:
Help ONE TOWER by voting YES on Steam Greenlight!
"One Tower aims to be far more accessible for players intimidated by the complex nature of traditional MOBAs." - Cliqist
"..controlling your minions in LoL is very important, but in One Tower, it means a hell of a lot more.." - Games Ring
ONE TOWER combines popular design elements from the RTS and RPG genres in this all-new, free-to-play micro MOBA set in the fantastical world of Eternal Flame.
Summon your minions, pick your Hero, and get ready for ONE TOWER – the first micro MOBA that’s quick to play, easy to learn and insanely fun to play against one another.
With cross-platform play powered by the Unity 5 engine, competitive play in leagues and special events, hundreds of items to unlock, and weekly game updates, ONE TOWER promises to deliver never-ending fun and excitement.
Free-to-play head-to-head strategy game for PC and Mac
Configure your minion waves. Choose from Melee, Ranged, Air, Siege and more
Experience an arcade-style battle arena: Pick up speed boosts, damage modifiers and health on the map to gain an edge
Trigger deadly traps to surprise your enemy
Play through story campaigns to experience the Eternal Flame universe
Over 12 Heroes to choose from in Season One
Over 30 Minions to choose from in Season One
Customize your tower
Participate in tournaments and special events
ONE TOWER is the game WE want to play. Why? Here’s why:
We are tired of watching mindless, useless minions running to an enemy’s tower in other MOBAs.
We want more control of the game. Why only a hero? Why not control your minion waves?
We love the classic RTS game unit types including melee, ranged, siege and air… and having LOTS of them to choose from.
We want a fun head-to-head battle arena game that is specifically designed for head-to-head play.
We want heroes to be simple again like we experienced in Warcraft III. No more going through hundreds of item descriptions in an item shop to create the perfect build only to have your items nerfed in a game update.
We don’t want to have 30-60 minute matches. Many of us have families and cannot play for 2 hours. We can get in 6-8 matches within an hour.
ONE TOWER is designed and balanced so that the typical match will last between 10-15 minutes. Higher-skilled players may be able to end games within 6 minutes if they can get the early advantage.
In the event of a stalemate, players can opt for a secondary objective of killing the siege demon to force an attack on the enemy tower which will cause considerable damage. After a few of these tower attacks the game will end. Our siege demon can be taken as early as level 9 and respawns every minute.
ONE TOWER isn’t just another MOBA game and does not try to replace larger MOBAs like League of Legends, DOTA 2, Heroes of the Storm or SMITE. We expect many players to play ONE TOWER in between longer matches of their favorite game, whether it be one of the aforementioned games or a game from a completely different genre.
Players can control their minion wave configurations, whether you want tanks, casters, healers, air, DPS or siege, you can configure your wave and change them on the fly to dominate and outwit your opponent.
No more learning and memorizing the perfect item builds or tech trees. Players of all skill levels will be able to jump into the game and immediately understand how to play.
Toxicity arises the most when teammates are feeding the enemy team and causing you to lose 30-60 minutes of your life that you’ll never get back. No more having to argue over who will jungle, take mid, top or bottom. No more complaints about why you didn’t heal, gank or ward.
ONE TOWER will foster competitive play and sportsmanship in it's community. You’ll need to outwit and outplay your opponent instead of trying to anger your teammate into surrendering or going AFK.
The Eternal Flame universe is tightly intertwined. Everything and everyone is connected and has a specific role to play in our story, from heroes, locations, beasts and minions to their origins, abilities and appearances.
Explore a bit of our world’s lore below and discover more as we release it.
The ancients have passed their stories of legend and lore on to the generations that have survived Prestiya. Whether these generations have survived because of fate or fortune, it makes no difference, these stories both haunt the dreams of children and inspire those hoping to become Prestiya’s next legendary hero, to have their names and victories spoken of by the generations to come.
These histories of Prestiya are often challenged by the scholars who claim they are children’s stories. Stories of people who live in the forests called The Flow who can harness the power of nature to crush their enemies. Stories of beasts the size of mountains and the undead that dwell in the underdepths of the Arrian Rift.
Prestiya is a small continent with treacherous environments. The Valley of Arrian is the most lush and coveted piece of land not only because of its rich soil and resources, but also because of the natural safe haven its surroundings provide, with mountains to the north and south, the rift to the west and the ocean to the east. Raiders attempting an attack from the mountains would need to be on foot and would likely fall to their deaths or run out of food before initiating an attack. An attack from the water would also be unlikely due to the razor sharp reefs.
The Sca are the first known civilization in Prestiya. They took claim of the Valley of Arrian and established a stringent set of rules and judgements that were so harsh no one dared to break them, and no tribe or people ever attempted to challenge their claim to the valley. Sca made great advances in architecture and weapon technology that often resembled magic. The Sca kingdom is protected by a series of towers spread throughout the valley’s entry points. These towers stand alone and are powered by the ground beneath them – pulling energy into them creating a pulse energy that fires at any hostile threats detected nearby.
As the Sca fell into a deep slumber of increasing their gain and leisure, a great change has been happening around them, invisible to their complacent eyes. Many would be forced to wake and face the reality of their world as the wilds of Prestiya fall upon them.
Every hero is designed around a particular faction which establishes their origins and play style. Our story begins with these four factions.
The Sca have been the protectors of the Eternal Flame since the beginning of civilization in Prestiya. They live by strict laws of purity without compromise and those who fail to follow them are exiled without question. Because of this, the once unstoppable empire is now at its most vulnerable state.
The Firelords were formed by many of the original lords from the Sca. Now banished, the Firelords claim the Eternal Flame is rightfully theirs and they will stop at nothing to see it returned to their hands. They are heavy handed and often ask questions later.
Necro were once a part of Sca’s elite army, trained from birth to protect Sca kingdom. When Lord Bantinan was killed by Galagor on their watch, the Sca lords damned them to the underworld.
The Necro, while dark and mutated in appearance, are actually the most misunderstood in our universe. Their banishment to the underworld was a cruel and unfair penalty for their alleged failure to protect Lord Bantinan, and they will do everything they can to see redemption and to rise again and take back their home.
Flow are believed to have existed before the Sca and many suspect they were born from the Eternal Flame. Flow are connected to earth, air, water and fire. They have little interest in the Eternal Flame and are guardians of nature, using fire only as a last resort.
Flow’s heroes do not desire destruction, favoring harmony with nature. When in combat, Flow heroes are calm, but powerful, exerting little effort while packing a punch.
ONE TOWER’s heroes are key to tipping the battle scales in your favor. Heroes have unique abilities that players must learn to harness to assist them in battle against the enemy hero, minions and jungle creep.
All heroes are designed to be damage dealers, but each hero is also designed to have a support ability to assist them in battle. As your hero earns experience points it will level up which will allow you to unlock and upgrade special abilities.
Because ONE TOWER relies heavily on minion control and management, heroes in ONE TOWER do not have item builds. Many minions are designed with their own passive abilities that can affect or assist the hero, including heals, stuns and other buffs.
When players first begin playing ONE TOWER, they will be given a hero upon completing the tutorial campaign. After, players can unlock additional heroes by using Ore that is earned in-game through winning matches, or they can purchase mystery treasure chests that may grant a hero. At ONE TOWER’s release players will have over a dozen heroes to choose from, with new heroes continuously being added as part of new game updates.
Minions are the cornerstone of ONE TOWER. Players will need to micro-manage their minion wave configurations and counter the enemy’s waves in order to win.
Choose from a variety of minion types, including:
Tanks
DPS
Ranged & Casters
Healers
Siege
Air
Anti-Air
Support & Utility
Using gold earned in-game, players will buy and deploy new minions to the lane in the order they choose. You can earn gold through killing minions, jungle creep, and your opponent’s hero.
Players will earn a core set of minions through completing tutorial campaigns and may earn more either through completing campaigns, unlocking via Ore earned from winning matches or through opening mystery chests.
Heroic Minions are a special kind of minion that can be earned from mystery chests. Heroic Minions closely resemble common minions but are able to be upgraded by winning matches and can earn special abilities. For example, a Heroic Archer can be upgraded into a Fire Archer and so on.
ONE TOWER’s battle arena was carefully designed for head-to-head arcade style gameplay in mind and to give players a level of depth rarely found in MOBAs. Players are given only a single tower to protect them in a single lane leaving no room for mistakes.
The battle arena has power-ups spread throughout the map. Players will need to time the power-up respawns in order to control the map while pushing the lane and clearing the jungle at the same time.
To raise the stakes even higher, we’ve added a few surprises to the map, including traps to ensnare your enemy, a trader to boost your income and a siege beast that attacks your opponent’s tower when captured.
Additional battle arenas will be designed after the release of ONE TOWER or upon reaching the stretch goal to allow us to design more arenas for players.
Players will be able to jump into a Quick Match with players of similar level, or choose to be pitted against other players of similar level and win ratio within Ranked Match. Players can also directly challenge friends to an unranked match.
In addition to these matchmaking modes we will host special events for players including prize-based tournaments and leagues.
We’re a small indie game development studio and we’ve been able to build a playable version of ONE TOWER through keeping our development costs to a minimum. The funding goal will help us fund the additional content needed in order to complete and release the game.
In addition to the funding, Kickstarter provides us with an amazing platform to receive direct and early feedback from the Kickstarter gaming community which is an invaluable tool for helping us shape the game. We also look forward to playing ONE TOWER during early beta access with our supporters!

SKYREACHER is an independent game development studio. We are headquartered in beautiful Murrieta, California, less than an hour away from San Diego and Los Angeles. Founded in 2010, SkyReacher's team consists of game industry veterans who have worked on dozens of titles including EverQuest, Quake III Arena, Unreal Tournament, DC Universe Online, Clone Wars Adventures, Baldur's Gate II and Rainbow Six.
Our core team shares a strong passion for e-sports gaming which is demonstrated in the very heart of ONE TOWER. In our personal time we can be found streaming on Twitch playing games like CS:GO, Hearthstone, League of Legends, DOTA2, Starcraft 2 and Overwatch.
Meet the Team
In addition to our core team we have specialist contractors working on key areas of the game including network security, writing and more.
Two of our development team members are graduates of Full Sail University’s programming and art programs. Full Sail University offers campus and online degree programs that are designed for the world of entertainment and media. Offering associate's, bachelor's, and master's degrees, Full Sail's approach is centered on real-world industry experience which we’ve witnessed first-hand with our very own grads.
We’ve partnered with several studios that create assets for the Unity Asset Store. These studios share our passion for games and much of the content found in ONE TOWER for minions and even some of our heroes were licensed from them. Without these studios, our game would not be where it is today in such a short amount of time while keeping our development costs to a minimum.

Risks and challenges
As with all games, development is a very iterative process and with the introduction of new features many challenges may arise, including bugs and balancing issues. This may cause delays in release. SkyReacher has been in business for over 5 years and these delays will not risk the completion of ONE TOWER. 

Our team is committed to providing a quality experience that everyone can enjoy. Not only do we want YOU to enjoy the game, but we are making this game because we want to play it too. This our greatest priority.
